member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.Js.PromiseBody.Script
member.summary: The body of the promise. Supports the following 'default' tokens: {resolve} - To resolve the promise (need to call with paranthesis IE: {resolve}(23) will resolve 23). {reject} - To reject the promise need to call with paranthesis IE: {reject}(43) will reject and pass the value 43). {args} - To refer to the arguments array of the intial function. * Attempting to reference the arguments object by name in the script will return the promises arguments and not what was passed in.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.Hub
member.summary: The url that will be used to post the registration request. This option takes precedence over -hubHost and -hubPort options.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.HubHost
member.summary: IP or hostname : the host address of the hub we're attempting to register with. If -hub is specified the -hubHost is determined from it.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.HubPort
member.summary: The port of the hub we're attempting to register with. If -hub is specified the -hubPort is determined from it.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.Id
member.summary: Optional unique identifier of the remoteHost, when not specified.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.MaxSession
member.summary: Max number of tests that can run at the same time on the node, irrespective of the browser used

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.NodeConfig
member.summary: Filename : JSON configuration file for the node. Overrides default values

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.NodePolling
member.summary: In ms : specifies how often the hub will poll to see if the node is still responding.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.NodeStatusCheckTimeout
member.summary: In ms : connection/socket timeout, used for node "nodePolling" check.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.Port
member.summary: The port number the server will use.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.Proxy
member.summary: The class used to represent the node proxy. Default is [org.openqa.grid.selenium.proxy.DefaultRemoteProxy].

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.Register
member.summary: If specified, node will attempt to re-register itself automatically with its known grid hub if the hub becomes unavailable.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.RegisterCycle
member.summary: In ms : specifies how often the node will try to register itself again. Allows administrator to restart the hub without restarting (or risk orphaning) registered nodes. Must be specified with the "-register" option.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.RemoteHost
member.summary: URL: Address to report to the hub. Used to override default (http://<host>:<port>).

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.SessionTimeout
member.summary: In seconds : Specifies the timeout before the server automatically kills a session that hasn't had any activity in the last X seconds. The test slot will then be released for another test to use. This is typically used to take care of client crashes. For grid hub/node roles, cleanUpCycle must also be set. If a node does not specify it, the hub value will be used.

member.name: P:ApertureLabs.Selenium.SeleniumNodeOptions.UnregisterIfStillDownAfter
member.summary: In ms : if the node remains down for more than [unregisterIfStillDownAfter] ms, it will stop attempting to re-register from the hub.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.BaseElement.Click
member.summary: Clicks this element.

remarks.para: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined. behavior.
If this element is not clickable, then this operation is ignored. This allows you to simulate a users to accidentally missing the target when clicking.

member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element: Attribute nameValue returned if not explicitly specifiedValid element types
checkedcheckedCheck Box
selectedselectedOptions in Select elements
disableddisabledInput and other UI elements

remarks.para: Click this element. If the click causes a new page to load, the method will attempt to block until the page has loaded. After calling the method, you should discard all references to this element unless you know that the element and the page will still be present. Otherwise, any further operations performed on this element will have an undefined. behavior.
If this element is not clickable, then this operation is ignored. This allows you to simulate a users to accidentally missing the target when clicking.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.Option.OptionElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute for this element.
member.returns: The attribute's current value. Returns a if the value is not set.
member.remarks:
The method will return the current value of the attribute, even if the value has been modified after the page has been loaded. Note that the value of the following attributes will be returned even if there is no explicit attribute on the element: Attribute nameValue returned if not explicitly specifiedValid element types
checkedcheckedCheck Box
selectedselectedOptions in Select elements
disableddisabledInput and other UI elements

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.Option.OptionElement.GetCssValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a CSS property of this element.
member.param: The name of the CSS property to get the value of.
member.returns: The value of the specified CSS property.
member.remarks: The value returned by the method is likely to be unpredictable in a cross-browser environment. Color values should be returned as hex strings. For example, a "background-color" property set as "green" in the HTML source, will return "#008000" for its value.

member.param: The name JavaScript the JavaScript property to get the value of.
member.returns: The JavaScript property's current value. Returns a if the value is not set or the property does not exist.

member.name: M:ApertureLabs.Selenium.WebElements.Option.OptionElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits this element to the web server.
member.remarks: If this current element is a form, or an element within a form, then this will be submitted to the web server. If this causes the current page to change, then this method will block until the new page is loaded.
